people.bio:
I started playing with Android in late 2010 as an embedded engineer, then I moved to the "Application layer", publishing a few weekend projects.

My personal most popular Android app is Kindle Gratis, a Kindle companion app with almost 100k downloads. I like Open Source projects. I'm a big fan of a lot of fancy Android libraries out there and I contribute with bug reporting, fixing and feedbacks.

I approached Reactive Programming in 2013 and I started using it in Android thanks to RxJava by Netflix. I'm using it in every Android app I work on since then, because RxJava solves so many issues on Android and it gives you a new perspective about mobile programming.

In 2013 I co-founded Alter Ego, a mobile and embedded solutions company. In 2015 I published RxJava Essentials for Packt Publishing. I'm currently writing Grokking Rx for Manning Publishing.

Gautier is an aspiring Software Craftsman at happn in Paris, France.

Agile thinker passionate in Android Development, he creates and maintains some FOSS tools to improve productivity.

Talk to him about Kotlin, Clean Code, or Free Software and you will see his eyes light up.

Co-founder of the Alter Ego Mobile Solutions and Android developer for the past 5 years, I have been working for companies like the United Nations, Telecom Italia and working on projects like the Sochi Winter Olympics app. I got bitten by the reactive programming bug a while ago and I am currently writing a book for Manning Publishing about it with other 2 colleagues.

Said is a Google Developers Expert on Android. He has been an Android Developer since Cupcake with apps for Android, Google Glass, Android Wear. He is a very passionate developer who tries to live on the bleeding edge of technology and is very interested in mobile UX.

He is also an active member and organizer at GDG Istanbul enjoying organizing various conferences and hackathons. In addition, he is part of GDG[X] - a GDG related open-source organization.

Anton is a software engineer at JunoLab. While focusing mostly on Android development, he is also passionate about alternative JVM-based languages, Kotlin and Groovy especially.

His other professional interests include continuous integration ("One Button to rule them all") and game development. Anton is a co-organizer of Google Developers Group Minsk and an active speaker at mobile and Java conferences.

A Tokyo based Android developer.

I'm working at Recruit Technologies Co.,Ltd and developing Android app/server side Java.

And I'm one of the member of DroidKaigi, the biggest Android conference in Tokyo.

Magda studied product design at Central Saint Martins and the Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw and decided to mix her passion for technology with the traditional craft she learned to work on digital products. Currently, she works as a UI Designer at Polidea, where she’s part of mixed developer-designer teams who create mobile apps. She also runs the Design Practice Meetup and is one of the organisers of MCE Conferences.

Almost 6 years of experience in programming, 5 of which as an Android developer. I participated in many business projects and I eagerly share my knowledge with other people. Currently I am Senior android engineer @Polidea.

Programming is not only a job, it is my passion and hobby... Nothing more, nothing less about me :)

Developer Advocate at Google London, helping developers leverage the power of Android Studio and Tools, as well as providing general outreach for the Android platform. Previously member of the Google Developer Experts program and co-founder and long time organiser at GDG Warsaw.

Researcher designer, programmer with almost all mobile technologies experience. Focused on secured and beautiful solutions. Founder of Meet.mobile – Wroclaw mobile developers group. Currently team leader at BLStream company.

Bernard Pletikosa has started playing with Android as a student in Zagreb few years ago. Currently, he is working as an Android developer at Relayr in Berlin bringing things to life by building Relayr IoT SDKs and manager apps.

Michał is Android Developer for all kinds of wearables, done programming for things such Oakley Airwave, Glass, Sony Smartwatch, and lately found his place in Android Wear development. Author of libraries such BusWear, WaitingDots, Nammu, also sharing his knowledge to the community by organizing many of Warsaw GDG meetings. Currently doing Android development at 12Hours, and many side-projects.

Roman has been working with Android for more than 6 years. You can find him delivering fixes and new features to a plenty of Android libraries and frameworks including support library, Robolectric, Madge, Spoon, Retrofit, and Helium.

At Stanfy he is working on a customized Android OS for in-room tablets installed at hotels by KEYPR.

people.websiteTitle: Software developer at SoftServe, Leader at Women Techmakers Ukraine
people.bio: Kseniia is working as software developer at SoftServe as well she has an experience of working on open-source project during Google Summer of Code. Kseniia is leading Women Techmakers Ukraine and GDG Dnipropetrovsk communities for 3 years. She participated in number of international conferences: GOTO Aarhus, Google I/O and GDG Leaders Summit and was a speaker at Droidcon Berlin, Women Techmakers Istanbul, GDG DevFest Ukraine and Women Techmakers Global TechTalk. This year Kseniia was selected as Anita Borg Scholar Receipient that aimed to support women with outstanding results in Computer Science. Kseniia is a big fan of innovative technologies in education and software development. She is creator of Android application for Women Techmakers Community.

Basically a technology geek. Mainly focused on the marketing and design of mobile applications. Passionate about marketing, UX, IoT and Android. Since 2012, he has been writing technology news and articles on protechman.net

Organizer of the Google Developer Group Istanbul & Chief Problem Solver of Mobil Istanbul. Speaks at conferences worldwide. Also known as Protechman.

people.websiteTitle: Google Developers Expert on Android @ Yalantis
people.bio:
Roman is a technology geek, leading developer with 10+ years of experience, and a Google Developer Expert on Android at Yalantis company.

He is skilled in building cutting-edge mobile apps, mainly developing for Android and wearable devices.

For two years Roman is an organizer and active member at GDG Dnipropetrovsk, where he had already organized a variety of local meet-ups, conferences and hackathons.

Head of Mobile at Tango Agency and Android developer for the past 5 years. Big fan of reactive programming and design patterns. In his free time he is developing Scrobble FM application, which has been recognized in competitions conducted by the portals AntyApps.pl and Android.com.pl. Besides programming, his time is effectively fulfilled by the culinary experiments and photography.

I'm an Android developer since late 2009, and worked on many different projects during my early career in Turkey. Currently working in Berlin at eBay Kleinanzeigen (Classifieds) as Senior Android Developer. I'm passionate about Android and also clean code and code quality.

Mateusz is a GDG Kraków co-organizer and a Google Developer Expert for Android. On a daily basis he works at Base where he uses his Android abracadabras to make sales representatives more productive. Fresh father of twins, writing this bio having a child on his arm.
